publicationStmt.publisher: Uppsala University, Department of linguistics and philology

msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Numbers 2
ab.l: And the Lord spoke to Moses and to Aaron,saying,
‘Every man, the children of Israel, shall camp by his own standard with the signsby their father’s house: they shall camp opposite,all around the tent of meeting.
And theones camping toward the rising of the sun: eastward is the standard of the camp of Judahby their armies. And the superior over the army is Nahshon,son of Amminadab.
And his army, and those that were numberedof them, are seventy-four thousand and six hundred.
And the ones camping next to him is the tribe of Issachar. And the princeof the children of Issachar is Nethanel, son of Zuar.
And his army, and those that were numbered of them, are fifty-four thousand andfour hundred.
And next to him: the tribe of Zebulun. Andthe prince of the children of Zebulun is Eliab the son of Helon.
And his army, and those that were numbered of them, are fifty-seven thousand and fourhundred.
All those numbered in the camp of Judah were a hundred andeighty thousand and six thousand and four hundred, by their armies.They shall set out in the first line.
The standard of the camp of Reubenis southward, by their armies. And the prince of the children of Reubenis Elizur, son of Shedeur.
And his army,and those that are numbered of them, are forty-six thousand and five hundred.
And the ones camping by him is the tribe of Simeon. And the princeof the children of Simeon is Shelumiel, son of Zurishaddai.
And his army, and those that were numbered of them, are fifty-nine thousand and threehundred.
And the tribe of Gad. And the prince of the children of Gadis Eliasaph, son of Deuel.
And his army, and those that were numberedof them, are forty-five thousand and six hundred and fifty.
Allthose numbered in the camp of Reuben are a hundred thousand and fifty-one thousandand four hundred and fifty, by their armies. And they shall set out in the second line.
And the tent of meeting, the camp of the Levites, shall set outin the midst of the camps. As they camp,so shall they set out, every man in his place by their standards.
The standard of the camp of Ephraim by their armies is westward. Andthe prince of the children of Ephraim is Elishama, son of Ammihud.
And his army, and those numbered of them, are forty thousandand five hundred.
And next to him is the tribe of Manasseh. Andthe prince of the children of Manasseh is Gamaliel, son of Pedahzur.
And his army, and those numbered of them, are thirty-twothousand and two hundred.
And the tribe of Benjamin. And the princeof the children of Benjamin is Abidan, son of Gideoni.
And his army, and those numbered of them, are thirty-five thousand and fourhundred.
All those numbered of the camp of Ephraim are a hundred thousand andeight thousand and a hundred, by their armies. And they shall set out in the third line.
The standard of the camp of Dan is northward, by their armies.And the prince of the sons of Dan is Ahiezer, son of Ammishaddai.
And his army, and those numbered of them, are sixty-two thousand and sevenhundred.
And the ones camping by him is the tribe of Asher.And the prince of the sons of Asher is Pagiel, son of Ocran.
And his army, and those numbered of them, are forty-one thousand and five hundred.
And the tribe of Naphtali. And the prince of the sons of Naphtaliis Ahira, son of Enan.
And his army, and those numberedof them, are fifty-three thousand and four hundred.
All those numberedof the camp of Dan are a hundred thousand and fifty-seven thousand and six hundred. They shall set out lastby their standards.’

These are those numberedof the sons of Israel by the house of their fathers. All those numbered of the campsby their armies are six times a hundred thousand and three thousand and fivehundred and fifty.
And the Levites were not numbered amongthe sons of Israel, as the Lord commanded Moses.
And the sons of Israel did according to all that the Lord commandedMoses: so they camped, and so they set out, every manby their families, by the house of their fathers.
